intro: Leucomeris glabra, commonly known as the smooth leucomeris, is a species of flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and large, palmate leaves. It produces showy, pink or white flowers that bloom in clusters. Leucomeris glabra is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
